meanings.definition: Firm or obstinate continuance in a course of action in spite of difficulty or opposition.
meanings.sent1: Her persistence in solving the puzzle paid off in the end.
meanings.sent2: His persistence in practicing the piano every day led to a beautiful performance.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's persistence in trying to reach the bird feeder was both amusing and impressive.
meanings.sent4: Like a river carving through rock, her persistence shaped her path to success.
meanings.sent5: The image of the ant tirelessly carrying a leaf showcases the true essence of persistence.

meanings.definition: The continued or prolonged existence of something.
meanings.sent1: The persistence of the old traditions brought comfort to the community.
meanings.sent2: The persistence of the rumor caused confusion among the students.
meanings.sent3: The persistence of the cat waiting by the door for its owner was both cute and slightly annoying.
meanings.sent4: The persistence of the stars in the night sky reminded him of the enduring beauty of the universe.
meanings.sent5: The persistence of the ancient ruins tells a story of civilizations long gone.

meanings.definition: The continued or prolonged existence of something.
meanings.sent1: The persistence of the smell lingered in the room long after the meal was finished.
meanings.sent2: The persistence of the melody in his mind kept him humming all day.
meanings.sent3: The persistence of the spider building its web in the same spot every day was both fascinating and predictable.
meanings.sent4: The persistence of the sun rising each morning symbolizes the constancy of nature.
meanings.sent5: The persistence of the memories brought both joy and sorrow to her heart.
